Articles.Content:
Long time since I've last posted, full release already! 

Anyway, I've been wandering around Dres in career mode and such because nobody seems to go to Dres anymore. After a time I noticed mention of Dres-teroids. After doing a bit of reading on the wiki, apparently these dres-teroids are in orbit around dres in a ring system. As such I have to wonder if this means Dres will get a faint ring system in the future? Maybe make it more interesting to go to so one can see the rings of this out of the way dwarf world? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) What do you guys think?
If the devs implemented a Saturn like ring system on Dres, it would definitely make me want to travel there more often. I have a few thousand hours logged and yet I've only been to Dres once.
No ring, sadly. Now asteroids spawn near Dres orbit, like they do near Kerbin.

> 
> I have a few thousand hours logged and yet I've only been to Dres once.

This pleases me.

It is possible for a dwarf planet or an asteroid to have "rings" - crude, uneven, faint ones. Remnants of the crap actual central objects has evolved from.

But to have rings like Saturn, that's absolutely impossible, as such rings are made possible by enormous tidal forces huge planets excert on any larger body that comes close.

> 
> It is possible for a dwarf planet or an asteroid to have "rings" - crude, uneven, faint ones. Remnants of the crap actual central objects has evolved from.
> But to have rings like Saturn, that's absolutely impossible, as such rings are made possible by enormous tidal forces huge planets excert on any larger body that comes close.

you mean smaller, right ?
The "dresteroids" aren't to emulate a ring system, they're there to represent the asteroid belt.

As everyone know, no one has ever been to Dres. I don't know why we should change that by adding interesting features to it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-19T13:54:16Z" title="07/19/2015 01:54  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 19, 2015</time> by Tatonf**

The Dres asteroids are in a ring around the planet. The longer you keep a ship there, the more of them appear. It would be cool I if the ring was visible to the naked eye, but it's not. It is a great place for orbital refuelling though.
There was talk about adding an underground prison on Dres, but after the word leaked out. Crime on Kerbin suddenly vanished. No ones likes going to Dres...
A ring would make Dres a more interesting destination, yes.

> 
> There was talk about adding an underground prison on Dres, but after the word leaked out. Crime on Kerbin suddenly vanished. No ones likes going to Dres...

They were planning to call it Drestralia.

What is this `dres` of which you speak?

I think I might have been twice but the memory of the second time is fading...

Not sure asteroids is enough to get me to go back
I was just there... but it didn't end well.

I went there a couple of times in previous versions--once with a crew lander for the sake of completionism, and once with two uncrewed rovers (with jump jets) so I could drive around in the big canyon and try some Evel Kernievel style stunts off the cliffs. Haven't been back since then but I would like to check out the dresteroids sometime.

I sent a Infrared Telescope out to scan Dres and it's neighborhood and in a very short time I located no less that 22 different Dres-orbiting objects, all in the same plane in roughly circular orbits ranging from 18,000 to 20,000 km.

![mRZch2U.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/mRZch2U.jpg)
Where's Dres in that image?

> 
> Where's Dres in that image?

It is so small that to show the orbits makes Dres disappear.
I just finished a Dres colony north of the big canyon. It carries 10 kerbals on the ground, and 2 in orbit to manage the return ship.
How do those asteroids spawn? Just randomly, and is there a limit? Add a whole bunch more and you got your ring ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> I sent a Infrared Telescope out to scan Dres and it's neighborhood and in a very short time I located no less that 22 different Dres-orbiting objects, all in the same plane in roughly circular orbits ranging from 18,000 to 20,000 km.
> [http://i.imgur.com/mRZch2U.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/mRZch2U.jpg)

Infrared telescope? A mod? Which?

As I was coming into orbit around Dres (SCANsat probe), they started popping into view (map view). Now that my probe has been there a while, more of them are apparent. I've not decided if I want to start tracking them yet. Maybe when my probe is done with scans, if I've fuel enough (*should be*), I'll go check one of them out.

> 
> 
> LordFerret said:
> 
> 
> Infrared telescope? A mod? Which?
> 
> 
> As I was coming into orbit around Dres (SCANsat probe), they started popping into view (map view). Now that my probe has been there a while, more of them are apparent. I've not decided if I want to start tracking them yet. Maybe when my probe is done with scans, if I've fuel enough (*should be*), I'll go check one of them out.
> 

I'm assuming he's talking about the Asteroid Day telescope, from the "2nd Official SQUAD mod for KSP".

Cursed: [http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/232196-asteroid-day](http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/232196-asteroid-day)

**Edited <time datetime="2021-05-19T18:07:15Z" title="05/19/2021 06:07  PM" data-short="3 yr">May 19, 2021</time> by Snark**
  
Link to defunct website removed by moderator

> 
> 
> Ignath said:
> 
> 
> I'm assuming he's talking about the Asteroid Day telescope, from the "2nd Official SQUAD mod for KSP".
> 
> 
> Cursed: [http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/232196-asteroid-day](http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/232196-asteroid-day)
> 

Oh yea. I forgot about that. I was thinking [Hullcam VDS](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46365) (*which has two telescopes, but not specifically IR*), which I already have. Thanks!
I've never heard of these until now. Perhaps it would be a great place to build a refuel station for missions venturing out into the outer solar system?

i visited dres and landed on an asteroid

![5194E68981A9802EE3E74632ABD991629721554B](https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/858352896510048304/5194E68981A9802EE3E74632ABD991629721554B/)
